title: How to Add Text to Photos

methods.name: Using Markup on an iPhone or iPad

steps.headline: Open your iPhone or iPad’s Photos app.
steps.description: It's the multicolored flower on a white background typically found on the home screen. This method teaches you how to use the built-in Markup tool to add text to an image.

steps.headline: Select a photo.
steps.description: Tap the album (e.g., Camera Roll ) where the photo is located, then tap the photo to open it.

steps.headline: Tap Edit.
steps.description: It’s at the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.headline: Tap the three dots ⋯ in a circle.
steps.description: It’s at the top-center part of the screen on some models, and at the bottom-right on others. A menu will expand at the bottom.

steps.headline: Tap Markup.
steps.description: It’s the icon with a pen tip. This opens the photo in a tool that allows you to draw on and add text to any image.

steps.headline: Tap +.
steps.description: It’s at the bottom-right corner. This expands more options.

steps.headline: Tap Text.
steps.description: A text box containing the word “Text” now appears on the screen with two blue dots on either side.

steps.headline: Tap aA to choose your text options.
steps.description: It's in the bottom toolbar. A pop-up will appear, allowing you to fine-tune your text. Tap the font you want to type in to select it. Use the slider to increase or decrease the size of the text. Tap one of blue lined icons at the bottom to choose how your text will be aligned. Tap the aA  icon again to close the window.

steps.headline: Tap the black circle to select a text color.
steps.description: It’s in the bar at the bottom of the screen (to the left of the aA icon). If you’d like to choose another color, tap the one you’d like to use. Tap the multicolored circle at the bottom-right corner of the screen to expand a larger menu of more colors.

steps.headline: Tap the text box and select Edit.
steps.description: This springs open the keyboard.

steps.headline: Type your text.
steps.description: When you’re finished, tap anywhere on the image to close the keyboard. If you change your mind about any of the settings you chose, you can make as many changes as you wish before you save the image. Just tap the text to bring up the editing tools at the bottom of the screen.

steps.headline: Drag the text to the desired position.
steps.description: Simply tap and drag the text to place it anywhere on the image.

steps.headline: Tap Done.
steps.description: It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. This returns you to the regular photo editor.

steps.headline: Tap Done.
steps.description: It’s at the bottom-right corner. This saves your changes.

methods.name: Using Adobe Photoshop Express for iPhone\/iPad and Android

steps.headline: Install Adobe Photoshop Express on your phone or tablet.
steps.description: This free app allows you to add text to images on your iPhone, iPad, or Android. You can download it for free from the App Store (iOS) or Play Store (Android). There are a variety of other free apps that allow you to add text to photos. If you don’t want to use Photoshop Express, you can search for “text on photos” in the App Store or Play Store to find an alternative.

steps.headline: Open Photoshop Express.
steps.description: It’s the gray icon containing a white diamond with “PS” inside. You’ll find it on the home screen or in the app drawer (Android). If it’s your first time using the app, follow the on-screen instructions to move through the welcome screens, and then tap your desired sign-in method (Google, Facebook, or Adobe ID) to set up your account. If prompted to give the app permission to access your photos, give that permission.

steps.headline: Tap the photo you want to edit.
steps.description: This opens it in the editor.

steps.headline: Swipe left across the toolbar and tap the T. The toolbar is the row of icons at the bottom of the screen.
Select a text style.
steps.description: Small previews of the various text styles appear right above the toolbar at the bottom of the screen. Scroll across the options, and tap the one you want to use. Some sample text will appear on the screen.

steps.headline: Tap the FONT menu and select a font.
steps.description: It’s in the row of options just below the image. Swipe across the various font faces, then tap the one you want to use.

steps.headline: Tap the COLOR menu and choose a color.
steps.description: It’s to the right of the FONT menu. Swipe across the colors, then choose one for your text. If you don’t see the color you want, tap the circle at the beginning of the row to bring up the color wheel, choose a color, then tap Done.

steps.headline: Tap the ALIGNMENT menu and choose an alignment.
steps.description: It’s to the right of the COLOR menu. The option you choose will change the way your text is aligned on the image.

steps.headline: Tap the sample text.
steps.description: This opens your keyboard.

steps.headline: Type your desired text and tap Done.
steps.description: Your text now appears in the selected style. If you change your mind about any of the settings you chose, you can make as many changes as you wish before you save the image.

steps.headline: Drag the slider to adjust the opacity.
steps.description: It’s right above the toolbar. Sliding it to the left makes the text appear more transparent.

steps.headline: Pinch (or reverse-pinch) the screen to change the size of the text.
steps.description: Place two fingers together on the text, then spread them outward to increase the size. Pinch two fingers together over the text to decrease the size.

steps.headline: Save your image.
steps.description: When you’re finished editing, tap the back button at the top-left corner to open the menu, then select Save.

steps.headline: Open Photos on your Mac.
steps.description: It’s the rainbow flower icon in the Dock. You can also double-click the photo you want to edit in Finder to open it in Photos.

steps.headline: Double-click the photo you want to edit.
steps.description: This opens the photo.

steps.headline: Click Edit.
steps.description: It’s near the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.headline: Click the three dots (⋯) in a circle.
steps.description: It’s on the right side of the tool. A menu will appear.

steps.headline: Click Markup.
steps.description: This opens the photo in an editing tool that allows you to add your own text.

steps.headline: Click the text tool.
steps.description: It’s the T icon in the toolbar at the top of the screen. A text box will appear on the photo containing some sample text.

steps.headline: Click the text style button.
steps.description: It’s the A in the toolbar. Several text options will appear.

steps.headline: Select your desired text options.
steps.description: Choose your desired font, text size, weight, and alignment options on the toolbar, then select a color from the color bar. The sample text will change as you make selections.

steps.headline: Click the text box and start typing.
steps.description: Your text will appear in the selected style.

steps.headline: Click and drag the text to the desired location.
steps.description: If you’re satisfied with the text’s location, there’s no need to do this step.

steps.headline: Click Save Changes when you’re finished.
steps.description: It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. The text is now saved on your photo.

steps.headline: Open Microsoft Paint on your PC.
steps.description: To do this, open the Windows search bar by clicking the magnifying glass or circle to the right of the Start button, then type Paint. Click Paint when it appears in the search results.

steps.headline: Click the File menu.
steps.description: It’s at the top-left corner of the window.

steps.headline: Click Open.
steps.description: A file selector will appear.

steps.headline: Select the photo you want to edit and click Open.
steps.description: If you’re not sure where to find it, try looking in the Pictures, Downloads, or Documents folders.

steps.headline: Click the text tool.
steps.description: It’s the A icon in the toolbar at the top of Paint.

steps.headline: Type your desired text.
steps.description: It will appear in small black letters by default.

steps.headline: Highlight the text when you’re finished typing.
steps.description: Highlighting the text allows you to change the way it appears. To highlight, click the mouse before or after the text, hold down the mouse button, and then drag the cursor so all text is selected.

steps.headline: Select your font options.
steps.description:
Click the drop-down menu just below the Text tab to view and select a font face, then choose a font size from the drop-down menu just beneath it. You can also stylize the text by clicking any of these buttons below the font menu:
To make the text bold, click the B icon. To use italics, click the i icon. To underline the text, click the U icon with a line beneath it. If you want the text to appear crossed-out, click the abc icon with a line through it. If you change your mind about any of the settings you chose, you can make as many changes as you wish before you save the image.

steps.headline: Click a color in the palette.
steps.description: This changes the text to that color.

steps.headline: Drag the text to another location.
steps.description: If you want to move the text, hold the mouse cursor right over one of the dotted lines that surround the text box—the cursor will turn to a 4-way arrow. Once you see the arrow, drag the text to the desired location.

steps.headline: Resize the text.
steps.description: To make the entire text selection larger or smaller, highlight the text, then choose a size from the drop-down menu in the "Font" panel.

steps.headline: Save your changes.
steps.description: Once you’re finished editing your text, click the File menu, select Save As, then save your file to the desired location.
